[[File:Deutsche Geschichte5-310.jpg|thumb|Hagenbach on trial, from Berner Chronik des Diebold Schilling dem Älteren]] [[File:Blason Hagenbach.svg|thumb|150px|right|[[Coat of arms]] of Hagenbach]] '''Peter von Hagenbach''' (or Pierre de Hagenbach or Pietro di Hagenbach or Pierre d’Archambaud or Pierre d'Aquenbacq, circa 1420 – May 9, 1474) was a [[Bourguignons|Bourguignon]] knight from [[Alsace]] and Germanic military and civil commander.
He was born into an [[Alsace|Alsatian]]-[[Bourgogne|Burgundian]] family, originally from [[Hagenbach, Haut-Rhin|Hagenbach]] and owned a castle there.
He was instated as [[Landvogt|bailiff of Upper Alsace]] by [[Charles the Bold]], [[Duke of Burgundy]], to administer the territories and rights on the [[Upper Rhine]] which had been mortgaged by [[Sigmund of Habsburg|Duke Sigmund of Further Austria]] for 50,000 [[Florin (Italian coin)|florins]] in the {{Interlanguage link multi|Treaty of St. Omer|fr|3=Traité de Saint-Omer}} in 1469. There he coined the term ''[[Landsknecht]]''{{citation needed|date=September 2014}}—from [[German language|German]], ''Land'' ("land, country") + ''Knecht'' ("servant").
It was originally intended to indicate soldiers of the [[Swabia|lowlands]] of the [[Holy Roman Empire]] as opposed to the [[Swiss mercenaries]]. As early as 1500 the [[Folk etymology|misleading spelling]] "''Lanzknecht''" became common because of the phonetic and visual similarity between ''Land''(''e'')''s'' ("of the land/territory") and ''Lanze'' ("[[lance]]").
Following a [[Burgundian Wars|rebellion]] by towns of the Upper Rhine against his tyranny, Hagenbach was put on trial for the atrocities committed during the occupation of [[Breisach]], found guilty of [[war crimes]], and [[Decapitation|beheaded]]<ref name="Schabas">[http://assets.cambridge.org/97805218/81258/excerpt/9780521881258_excerpt.pdf An Introduction to the International Criminal Court] William A. Schabas, [[Cambridge University Press]], Third Edition</ref> at Breisach. His trial by an [[ad hoc]] tribunal of the [[Holy Roman Empire]] in 1474 was the first “international” recognition of commanders’ obligations to act lawfully.<ref name="Greppi">[http://www.icrc.ch/web/eng/siteeng0.nsf/html/57JQ2X The evolution of individual criminal responsibility under international law] By Edoardo Greppi, Associate Professor of International Law at the [[University of Turin]], [[Italy]], [[International Committee of the Red Cross]] No. 835, p. 531-553, October 30, 1999.</ref><ref name="Grant">[http://www.law.harvard.edu/alumni/bulletin/2006/spring/gallery.php Exhibit highlights the first international war crimes tribunal] by Linda Grant, ''Harvard Law Bulletin''.</ref> He was convicted of crimes, specifically murder, rape and perjury, among other crimes, "he as a knight was deemed to have a duty to prevent." He defended himself by arguing that he was [[Superior orders|only following orders]]<ref name="Greppi"/> from the [[Duke of Burgundy]], to whom the Holy Roman Empire had given Breisach.<ref>[http://law.gsu.edu/Miller_Lecture/2006/MillerLecture-S06-BassiouniDraft.pdf The Perennial Conflict Between International Criminal Justice and Realpolitik] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080910183610/http://law.gsu.edu/Miller_Lecture/2006/MillerLecture-S06-BassiouniDraft.pdf |date=2008-09-10 }} February 10, 2006 Draft by M. Cherif Bassiouni -Distinguished Research Professor of Law and President, [[International Human Rights Law Institute]], [[DePaul University College of Law]], To be Presented March 14, 2006 as the 38th [[Henry J. Miller Distinguished Lecture]], [[Georgia State University College of Law]], and to appear in the [[Georgia State University Law Review]]</ref> Although there was no explicit use of a doctrine of [[command responsibility]], it is seen as the first trial based on that principle.<ref name="Schabas"/><ref name="Mens_Rea">[http://www.globalpolicy.org/intljustice/general/2005/command.htm Command Responsibility] The Mens Rea Requirement, By Eugenia Levine, [[Global Policy Forum]], February 2005</ref> As well, it includes the earliest documented prosecution of gender-based/targeted crimes when he was convicted for rapes committed by his troops.<ref name= "Luping">Luping, Diane. 2009. “Investigation and Prosecution of Sexual and Gender-Based Crimes before the International Criminal Court.” Journal of Gender, Social Policy & the Law. 17(2): 431–492.</ref>
==See also== *[[Burgundian Wars]]

revision.comment: Importing Wikidata [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "Simon Bolivar's declaration of no quarter" ([[Wikipedia:Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
revision.text:
{{short description|Simon Bolivar's declaration of no quarter}} [[File:El Libertador Simón Bolívar, Firmando el Decreto de GUERRA A MUERTE contra los Españoles.jpg|thumb|324x324px|[[Simón Bolívar]] signs the Decree of War to the Death in 1813, during his [[Admirable Campaign]].]] The '''Decree of War to the Death''', in Spanish '''''Decreto de Guerra a Muerte''''', was a decree issued by the South American leader [[Simón Bolívar]] which permitted murder and any atrocities whatsoever to be committed against civilians born in [[Spain]], other than those actively assisting South American independence, and furthermore exonerated Latin Americans who had already committed such murders and atrocities. The phrase "war to the death" was used as a [[euphemism]] for these atrocities.
The decree was an explicit "[[war of extermination]]" in Bolívar's attempt to maintain Venezuelan independence in the war with Spain, since he felt that the [[Spanish Army]]'s use of atrocities against those who supported the [[First Republic of Venezuela]] had contributed decisively to its defeat.<ref name=Arana>Arana, M. (2013). ''Bolivar''. New York: Simon & Schuster, {{ISBN|9781439110195}}</ref>{{rp|142-143}}
Bolívar promulgated the decree on June 15, 1813, in the Venezuelan city of [[Trujillo, Trujillo|Trujillo]].
==Background== The decree states that it was created as a response to severe crimes and massacres by [[Spain|Spanish]] soldiers after the fall of the First Republic, in which Spanish leaders allegedly stole property and executed thousands of Republicans: "we could not indifferently watch the afflictions inflicted to you by the barbaric Spaniards, who have annihilated you with robbery and destroyed you with death, infringed the most solemn treaties and capitulations [a reference to the San Mateo Capitulation, 1812]; in one word, committed every crime, reducing the Republic of Venezuela to the most horrific desolation." It proclaimed that all [[Peninsulares|Peninsular people]] in Spanish America who didn't actively participate in favor of its independence would be killed, and all South Americans would be spared, even if they had cooperated with the Spanish authorities.<ref>Stoan, ''Pablo Morillo'', 47-50.</ref> (See below for full declaration). The document's ultimate goal was to assure the Venezuelan elites that they would not be unfavorably treated for having collaborated with [[Juan Domingo de Monteverde|Domingo de Monteverde]] and the royalist authorities. The Decree was the first step in transforming the common and legal view of the Venezuelan war of liberation from a mere [[Insurgency|rebellion]] (or at best a [[civil war]]) taking place in one of [[Spain]]'s [[colony|colonies]], to a full-fledged international [[war]] between two distinct [[country|countries]], Venezuela and Spain.
==Practice of the "''Guerra a Muerte''"== This so-called ''Guerra a Muerte'' was widely practised on both sides, resulting in some extreme brutalities on both sides, such as the execution of Spanish prisoners in [[Caracas]] and [[La Guaira]] in February 1814, on orders from Bolívar himself, just before the collapse of the [[Second Republic of Venezuela]], and the killing of several renowned citizens in [[United Provinces of New Granada|New Granada]] by the royalist army under [[Pablo Morillo]] in 1815, 1816 and 1817.
The declaration remained in effect until November 26, 1820, when General [[Pablo Morillo]] met with Bolívar at [[Santa Ana de Trujillo]] to declare the war of independence a conventional war.
== Text of the Decree == {{Copy section to Wikisource}} Note: The term "Americans" here means natives of the American continent.
"''Venezuelans: an army of brothers, sent by the sovereign [[Congress]] of [[United Provinces of New Granada|New Granada]], has come to free you, and it is already amongst you, after evicting the oppressors from the provinces of [[Mérida (state)|Mérida]] and [[Trujillo (state)|Trujillo]].
''We are the ones sent to destroy the [[Peninsulares|Spaniards]], to protect the Americans, and to reestablish the [[republic]]an governments that formed the [[Confederation]] of [[First Republic of Venezuela|Venezuela]]. The states covering our arms (weapons) are once again ruled by their old [[constitution]]s and [[magistrate]]s, fully enjoying their liberty and independence; for our mission is only to break the chains of servitude, which still oppress some of our peoples, not claiming to create laws, or enforce acts of domination, which the right of war could authorize us to do.
''Touched by your misfortunes, we could not indifferently watch the afflictions inflicted to you by the barbaric Spaniards, who have annihilated you with robbery and destroyed you with death, infringed the most solemn treaties and capitulations; in one word, committed every crime, reducing the Republic of Venezuela to the most horrific desolation. It is so that justice demands vindication, and necessity forces us to take it. May the monsters that infest [[Americas|Colombian]] soil, and have covered it with blood disappear for good; may their punishment be equal to the magnitude of their treason, so that the stain of our [[shame|ignominy]] is washed off, and to show the nations of the universe that the sons of America cannot be offended without punishment.
''In spite of our just resentments against the iniquitous Spaniards, our magnanimity still deigns itself to open, for the last time, a route to conciliation and friendship; we still invite them to live peacefully among us, if, hating their crimes and turning to good faith, they cooperate with us in the destruction of the intruding government of Spain, and the reestablishment of the Republic of Venezuela.
''All Spaniards who do not conspire against tyranny in favor of our just cause, using the most effective and active resources, will be considered enemies, and will be punished as traitors to the homeland, and therefore, will be promptly executed. On the other hand, a general and absolute pardon is issued to all Spaniards who pass into our army, with or without their weapons; to those who offer aid to the good citizens working hard to shake off the shackles of tyranny. War officers and magistrates that proclaim the government of Venezuela and join our cause will keep their destinies and work positions; in one word, all Spaniards who perform service for the State will be reputed and treated as Americans.
''And you, Americans, who have been separated from the road of justice by error and perfidy, know that your brothers forgive you and seriously regret your misdeeds, intimately persuaded that you cannot be guilty, and that only the ignorance and blindness imposed on you by the authors of your crimes could cause you to perpetrate them. Do not fear the sword that comes to avenge you and cut the ignominious bindings which tie you to your executioners' fate. Rely on absolute immunity for your honor, life and properties; the mere title of Americans will be you warranty and safeguard. Our weapons have come to protect you, and will never be used against a single one of our brothers.
''This amnesty extends to the very traitors who have most recently committed their acts of [[felony]]; and will be so religiously carried out that no reason, cause or pretext will be enough to make us break our offer, no matter how extraordinary the reasons you give us to excite our adversity.
''Spaniards and Canarians, count on death, even if indifferent, if you do not actively work in favor of the independence of America. Americans, count on life, even if guilty.''"
(Please note, this English translation is subject to scrutiny.)
==References== {{reflist}}

At least 79 people {{Small|(per Houthi's Health Ministry)}} | victims = | perpetrators = {{flag|Saudi Arabia}} | assailants = | susperps = | weapons = | numparts = | dfens = | motive = | website = | module = }} {{Campaignbox Yemeni Crisis}} On 9 August 2018, Saudi Arabian expeditionary aircraft bombed a civilian school bus passing through a crowded market with U.S.-made bombs in [[Dahyan]], [[Saada Governorate]], [[Yemen]], near the border with [[Saudi Arabia]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/08/yemen-dozens-children-killed-wounded-school-bus-attack-180809085843444.html|title=Yemen: Dozens of civilians killed in school bus attack|date=10 August 2018|website=Al Jazeera|access-date=10 August 2018}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-45128367|title=Strike on Yemen bus kills 29 children|date=9 August 2018|work=BBC News|access-date=10 August 2018|language=en-GB}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/airstrike-by-us-ally-on-bus-carrying-yemeni-children-kills-and-wounds-scores/2018/08/09/c047e55e-bbc6-42ff-a5db-4bd2e629f0b6_story.html|title=Airstrike by U.S.-backed Saudi coalition on bus kills dozens of Yemeni children|last=Al-Mujahed|first=Ali|last2=Raghavan|first2=Sudarsan|date=9 August 2018|website=The Washington Post|language=en|access-date=10 August 2018}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/aug/19/us-supplied-bomb-that-killed-40-children-school-bus-yemen|title=US supplied bomb that killed 40 children on Yemen school bus|last=Borger|first=Julian|date=2018-08-19|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-09-17}} At least 40[https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/middleeast/us-saudi-yemen-bus-strike-intl/index.html Bomb that killed 40 children in Yemen was supplied by the US], August 17, 2018, CNN children were killed, all under 15 years old{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/aug/09/dozens-dead-in-yemen-as-bus-carrying-children-hit-by-airstrike-icrc|title=Dozens dead in Yemen as bus carrying children hit by airstrike|last=Dehghan|first=Saeed Kamali|date=9 August 2018|website=The Guardian|language=en|access-date=10 August 2018}} and most under age 10. Sources disagree on the exact number of deaths, but they estimate that the air strike killed about 51 people.{{Cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/International/children-dead-attack-yemen-market/story?id=57121579|title=Saudi-led coalition airstrike kills dozens of children on bus in Yemen|last=Marsri|first=Lena|date=9 August 2018|website=ABC News|language=en|access-date=10 August 2018}}{{Cite news|url=https://news.sky.com/story/airstrike-on-childrens-bus-is-a-low-point-in-yemen-war-unicef-11468505|title=Airstrike on children's bus is 'a low point' in Yemen war – UNICEF|work=Sky News|access-date=2018-08-10|language=en-GB}} == Attack == According to [[Save the Children]], at the time of the attack the children were on a bus heading back to school from a picnic when the driver stopped to get refreshment at the market in Dahyan. Most of the children were under age 10, according to the [[International Committee of the Red Cross]]. A Red Cross–supported hospital in [[Sa'dah|Saada]] received the bodies of 29 children under 15 years of age and 48 wounded individuals, 30 of whom were children.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/saudi-arabia-airstrike-yemen-kids-killed-bus-dahyan-market-saada-icrc-says/|title=Saudi coalition airstrike in Yemen kills 50, rebels say|access-date=2018-08-13|language=en}} A total of 40 children were killed in the strike.https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/middleeast/us-saudi-yemen-bus-strike-intl/index.html According to a resident of Dahyan, the warplanes had been loitering over the area for more than an hour before they attacked.{{Cite news|url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/dozens-children-killed-and-injured-airstrike-yemen-bus-red-cross-says-61507076|title=At least 29 children killed by Saudi-led air strike on Yemeni school bus|work=Middle East Eye|access-date=2018-08-13|language=en}} Another witness said, "Our shops were open and shoppers were walking around as usual. All those who died were residents, children and shop owners."{{Cite news|url=https://ewn.co.za/2018/08/10/saudi-air-strikes-in-yemen-described-as-grotesque|title=Saudi air strikes in Yemen described as 'grotesque'|last=Reuters|access-date=2018-08-13|language=en}} According to Yahya Hussein, a teacher who was traveling separately from the bus, "The scene can't be described—there was body parts and blood everywhere."{{Cite news|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/13/middleeast/yemen-children-school-bus-strike-intl/index.html|title=The schoolboys in Yemen were chatting and laughing. Then came the airstrike |first1=Nima |last1=Elbagir |first2=Salma |last2=Abdelaziz |first3=Sheena |last3=McKenzie |first4=Waffa |last4=Munayyer|work=CNN|date=2018-08-13|access-date=2018-08-14}} The bomb that killed the children was a 227 kg (500 lb) laser-guided [[Mark 82 bomb|Mk 82 bomb]] made by [[Lockheed Martin]]. It had been supplied by the [[United States]] to [[Saudi Arabia]]. == Media coverage == The attack came to light after videos were posted on [[Twitter]] depicting the remains of the bus and the children. Images of the victims were aired on the [[Almasirah|Al Masirah TV]] network, highlighting dramatic images of blood and debris-covered children lying on hospital stretchers. The Saudi Arabian coalition later issued a statement saying that they conducted an airstrike in Saada but were targeting [[Houthi]] missile launchers. The mass funeral of the children was aired on the Al Mariah TV network, with thousands of Yemenis participating.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/08/14/protests-at-funeral-for-yemeni-children-killed-in-coalition-strike.html|title=Protests at funeral for Yemeni children killed in coalition strike|last=Post|first=The Jakarta|work=The Jakarta Post|access-date=2018-08-14|language=en}} == Reactions == === Domestic === The official Saudi Arabian press agency called the strike a "legitimate military action" which targeted those who were responsible for a rebel missile attack on the Saudi Arabian city of [[Jizan]] on Wednesday.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/09/world/middleeast/yemen-airstrike-school-bus-children.html|title=Saudi Coalition Bombs School Bus in Yemen, Killing Dozens|access-date=10 August 2018|language=en}} They also claimed that the airstrikes "conformed to international and humanitarian laws" and that [[Houthis]] were using children as human shields. Yemeni journalist Nasser Arrabyee reported that there were no Houthis in the vicinity of the strike. A Houthi spokesman said that the coalition showed "clear disregard for civilian life", as the attack had targeted a crowded public place in the city. During the mass funeral of the children, many signs were visible protesting against the United States, Saudi Arabia, and Israel. On 1 September 2018, the Saudi Arabian-led coalition admitted mistakes, expressing regrets and pledged to hold those responsible for the strikes accountable.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-45382561|title='Mistakes' admitted in Yemen bus attack|date=2018-09-01|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-09-02|language=en-GB}} === International === United Nations Secretary-General [[António Guterres]] condemned the attack and called for an independent and prompt investigation, and UNICEF strongly condemned the attack. *{{Cite web|url=https://www.unicef.org/stories/reported-air-strike-school-bus-saada-northern-yemen|title=Reported air strike on school bus in Sa'ada, northern Yemen|website=www.unicef.org|language=en|access-date=10 August 2018}} *{{Cite news|url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2018/08/1016732|title=UN chief condemns air strike that hit school bus in northern Yemen, killing scores of children|date=9 August 2018|work=UN News|access-date=9 August 2018|language=en}} The United States Department of State called for Saudi Arabia to conduct an investigation into the strike.{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-yemen-security-usa/u-s-calls-on-saudi-led-coalition-to-probe-yemen-attack-idUSKBN1KU2DD|title=U.S. calls on Saudi-led coalition to probe Yemen attack|last=Beech|first=Eric|date=10 August 2018|work=Reuters|access-date=9 August 2018|editor-last=Zargham|editor-first=Mohammad|language=en-US}} The United Kingdom's Foreign and Commonwealth Office expressed "deep concern", called for a transparent investigation, and called upon all parties to prevent civilian casualties and to co-operate with the UN to reach a lasting political solution in Yemen. *{{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/AlistairBurtUK/status/1027929047161077761|title=Alistair Burt on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=2018-08-11|language=en}} *{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/calls-grow-for-investigation-of-deadly-attack-in-yemen-that-hit-school-bus-1533935919|title=Calls Grow for Investigation of Deadly Attack in Yemen That Hit School Bus|last=Fitch|first=Asa|date=2018-08-10|work=Wall Street Journal|access-date=2018-08-11|language=en-US|issn=0099-9660}} UK Foreign Secretary [[Jeremy Hunt]] defended the [[Saudi Arabia–United Kingdom relations|Saudi–British alliance]] as important in fighting Islamists.{{cite news |title=Foreign Secretary defends UK-Saudi ties after Yemen bus deaths |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/uk-45265871/foreign-secretary-defends-uk-saudi-ties-after-yemen-bus-deaths |work=BBC News |date=22 August 2018}} === Non-governmental organisations === The head of the Yemeni delegation of the [[International Committee of the Red Cross]] tweeted, "@ICRC_Yemen-supported hospital has received dozens of dead and wounded. {{Infobox civilian attack | title = Massacres of Keqëkolle and Prapashticë | partof = [[Yugoslav colonisation of Kosovo]] | location = Keqëkolle | target = Albanian civilians | coordinates = | date = | time = Midnight | type = Torture and execution | fatalities = 1020 | victims = 1020 | perpetrators = Serbian troops led by Radovan Radonić and Bozhidar Paunovic | weapons = axes, bayonets, rifles. | motive = Terror | convicted = None }} '''Massacres of Keqëkolle and Prapashticë''' ({{lang-sq|Masakrat ne Keqëkolle e Prapashticë}}) were a [[Yugoslav colonisation of Kosovo|series of massacres]] committed by Serbian troops of the [[Third Army (Serbia)|Third Army]], in the region of Gallapi, in the village Keqekolla, in Pristina, [[Kosovo]], on January 10, 1921.{{citation|surname1=[[Robert Elsie]]|title=Kosovo: In the heart of the powder keg|publisher=East European Monographs|at=p. 482|isbn=978-0-88033-375-7|date=1997|language=German|url=https://books.google.de/books?id=e4BpAAAAMAAJ&q=Kecekolla }} {{cite book |last1=Remzije Sherifi (1955) |first1=Ibrahim Rugova |title=La Question Du Kosovo (The Shadow Behind The Sun|location=Prishtina |page=54 |url=https://books.google.se/books?id=RIruxQEACAAJ&dq=Shadow+Behind+The+Sun+Remzije+Sherifi&hl=sv&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjp1JTkubroAhUotYsKHdMBA4MQ6AEIKDAA|accessdate=27 March 2020}} ==Massacre== The battalions was led by Radovan Radonić and Bozhidar Paunovic who, prior to the massacre, had committed several atrocities in the villages Popovë, Majac, Lupc, Bellopojë, Tërrnavë, Sharban, Koliq, Keqekollë, Ballaban and Prapashticë. On Januar 10, 1921, Serbian soldiers entered into Mulla Ademis house and forced him to watch as they beheaded his whole family.{{cite book |last1=Mani |first1=Kadri |title=Shqiptarët janë atje! |date=1999 |publisher=Koha |page=236 |edition=Thus, in 1921, in the mountain village of Keqekollë / Pri komtina, the Prishtinë / Pri komtina municipality, the Chetniks entered the house of Mulla Ademi at nightand murdered 9 nine family members: Mulla Adam was then beheaded in front of the house and the corpses cut to pieces and burned. |url=https://books.google.se/books?id=wwm5AAAAIAAJ&q=Mullah+Ademi+1921&dq=Mullah+Ademi+1921&hl=sv&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjO2rnXsrroAhVMEncKHaPUDSAQ6AEIKjAA |accessdate=27 March 2020 |language=sq}} The massacred included: his wife Mihrije Emërllahu, (68), his son Mehmet Emërllahu (30), Hasime Emërllahu (the sons wife), Selime Adem Emërllahu, Tahire Adem Emërllahu, Mustafë Adem Emërllahu, and a baby in a cradle.{{cite book |last1=R. |first1=Rexhepi, Masakra e Prapashticës by Prof. Dr. Hysen Matoshi |title=Takvimi 2012. "The Massacre of Prapashtice" |date=2012 |location=Prishtina |pages=315–322 |edition=Pjesa e shkrimeve te takvimit per 2012 |url=https://issuu.com/bislame.net/docs/takvimi2012/157 |accessdate=27 March 2020 |language=en}} Afterwards, Mulla Ademi was beheaded too and the bodies were cut to pieces and burned. Among the massacred was Mulla Ademi Emërllahu (1850-1921), an Albanian author, scholar and imam, who was forced to watch along as 9 family members were beheaded, before being beheaded himself. A total number of 1020 Albanian civlians were massacred, carried out by Colonel Radovan Radonić and Bozhidar Paunovic.{{cite news |title="Janari i zi" i Mulla Ademit |url=https://www.kosova-sot.info/lajme/66726// |accessdate=27 March 2020 |work=Kosova Sot |agency=Kosova Sot |issue="In January 1921, this family was killed and massacred by the Serbian soldiers in Keqekolle. The story of this tragic event is still known today as "Black January", which came after the occupation of Kosovo by Serbia and Montenegro, and after the Serbian and Montenegrin military power had settled on this side. From November 1912 to June 1914, Kosovo was the target of Serbian army violence, facing daily unprecedented violence onto defenseless Albanians." |date=13 January 2016 |language=en}} Of Mulla Ademis family, only one boy survived who was not present at the moment. It is believed that between 1020 and 1600 Albanians were killed in total that day.{{cite book |last1=Sopjani |first1=Naser |title=Lufta e UÇK-së në Malësinë e Gollakut, Grashticë, Keçekollë |date=2012 |publisher=Blue tech |location=Prishtina |page=37 |edition="The wars in Kosovo left indelible impressions even in the Gollak area, where this area was breached, it burned, was occupied and looted. Unforgettable for Gollaku is also the first half of January 1921, year where the so-called "Erfija" of power is applied Serbia, where only in the village of Prapashtica were cut and around 1200 Albanians were slaughtered without any fear no age or gender and 25 houses were burned. then, around 200 were massacred in Keekekollë and Ballaban inhabitants, with less in Ballaban37. According to some the number of sources varies and ranges from 1020 to 1600" |url=https://www.academia.edu/5193389/Lufta_e_U%C3%87K-s%C3%AB_n%C3%AB_Mal%C3%ABsin%C3%AB_e_Gollakut_Grashtic%C3%AB_Ke%C3%A7ekoll%C3%AB |language=en}} The month was called "Black January" afterwards by the locals.{{cite news |last1=Shaban |first1=Cakolli, Demir Krasniqi |title=Kënga e tij është pasuri e përgjithshme kombëtare |url=http://www.filolet.com/kulture_art/demir-krasniqi-kenga-e-tij-eshte-pasuri-e-pergjithshme-kombetare.htm |accessdate=27 March 2020 |work=www.filolet.com |agency=Filozofi dhe letërsi __histori kombëtare, vështrime, debat |issue=It was the black January of 1921, when the Serbian forces massacred civilians. The villages of Gollak were burned and terrorized by Serbian expeditions led by Colonel Radovan Radovic, who had a strong arm of the Bozidars gendarmeries. Paunovic was known as Bozidar Ballovci .The massacres began in the villages of Llap, Lupc, Majac, Luzhan, Batllava, Sharban, and from there the campaign took on dimensions in Gollak including Koliqi, Keqekolla and Prapashtica.}} ==Atrocities== After the massacre, the Serbian troops [[Gendercide|gathered all boys and men]] in the ages of 15-70 from the villages of Kurtaj, Qorraj, Çelaj, Myftaraj, Spahijaj, Balaj, to the town square where they were massacred, numbering 1020 Albanians.{{cite news |last1=Shaban |first1=Cakolli |title=AlbaniaPress.com / ShqiperiaPress.com - SHPALIME TE HIDHURA KUJTESE |url=http://www.albaniapress.com/lajme/7029/SHPALIME-TE-HIDHURA-KUJTESE-.html |accessdate=27 March 2020 |work=www.albaniapress.com |issue=fter the murder of Mulla Ademi, the Serbian army had gathered men from 15 to 70 years old in the neighborhoods of Keqekolla, such as: Kurtaj, Qorraj, Çelaj, Myftaraj, Spahijaj, Balaj, Govordhe and the entire population of this age of Prapashtica and Keqekolla gathered in one. the meadow in Prapashtica handcuffing and killing 1020 Gollaku Albanians. January and cold weather, heavy snow falling on the Gollaku highland had hampered the movements of the highlanders. , where captured residents killed, burned, bayoneted, set fire to their homes. The elderly who survived those events say all terror on the ground had been dreaded and the wolves had been reduced for several days. |date=2008}} The family of Gjaka were forced to wait outside as the Serb soldiers filled the house with hay and set it ablaze. The mother in the family tried to rescue the baby by throwing out the window. The soldiers continued to throw it back inside the house. After the baby was thrown out, the Serb soldiers shot and bayonetted it on the street.Remzije Sherifil, 1995, The Shadow Behind The Sun, (p.53)"Masakra në Prapashticë dhe Keqekollë, janar, 1921". (Massacre of Prapashticë and Keqekollë, 1996, VOL. {{Infobox civilian attack | title = Massacre of Gradec | partof = [[Serbia in the Balkan Wars]] | location = Gradec. | target = Albanian civilians | coordinates = | date = | time = | type = Massacres, executions, burning, pillaging, bombardment. | fatalities = 150 | victims = 105 | perpetrators = Serbian troops led by Nikola Jorgovanović, Ilia Novoselo, Marko Angjeli, Miladin Boshuk and Risto Turcani. | weapons = | motive = Terror | convicted = None }} '''Gradec Massacre''' ([[Albanian language|Alb]]. ''Masakra e Gradecit'') was part of a series massacres of 150 Albanian civilians in the village of Gradec, near Tetova and Gostivar, committed by the Serbian army led by Nikola Jorgovanović, on November 15, 1915.{{cite book |last1=of Kosovo |first1=Republic |title=Mbrojtja. Viti i 86-të i botimit Mars 2018/ Nr. 3. Xhaçka-Stoltenberg Vlerësohet kontributi ynë Vlerësohet kontributi ynë në misionet paqëruajtëse |date=2018 |publisher=Qendra e Kulturës, Medias, Botimeve të Mbrojtjes dhe Muzeut Drejtoria e Kulturës, Medias dhe Botimeve të Mbrojtjes |page=50 |url=http://www.mod.gov.al/images/mbrojtja/pdf/2018/mbrojtja_nr3_2018.pdf |accessdate=28 March 2020}} [[Edith Durham]] stated that in the village of Gostivar the Serbian forces massacred entire populations and burned down whole villages. In the village of Gradec, 50 Albanians were bayoneted and similar events occurred in Reçan, Reç, Zdunje, Raven, Vërtok, Mirditë, Orqush, Simnicë, Banjicë, Kalisht, Çegran and Qafë. The massacres were committed by Chetnik commander Ilia Novoselo, Marko Angjeli, Miladin Boshuk and Risto Turcani.{{cite news |last1=Ismaili |first1=Zeqirja |title=MASAKRA E GRADECIT, MË 05.11.1915 NGA USHTRIA SERBE U VRANË 150 SHQIPTARË |url=http://www.arsalbanica.mk/masakra-e-gradecit-me-05-11-1915-nga-ushtria-serbe-u-vrane-150-shqiptare/ |accessdate=28 March 2020 |work=Ars Albanica |issue=GRADEC MASSACRES, ON 05.11.1915 BY THE SERBIAN MILITARY KILLED 150 ALBANIANS |date=14 February 2020}} Atrocities had been begun in May 1915, where the Serbian forces harassed the Albanians living at the border. The Albanians of Reka were massacred by the Serbian Army in September 1915, and the houses were burned down and pillaged. The villages of Shtirovica, Tërnica, Strazimiri, and Reka were burned down and the inhabitants massacred. In the St. Jovan Bigori monastery in Shtirovica, Serb soldiers massacred 45 Albanians.{{cite book |last1=Nexhipi |first1=Reshat |title=Shtypja dhe rezistenca shqiptare në Maqedoni nëpër shekuj: tema të rralla të nxjerra nga bibliografia dhe biografia personale |date=1996 |page=75 |url=https://books.google.se/books?id=5HS5AAAAIAAJ&dq=Masakra+e+Gradecit+1915&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=Gradec |accessdate=28 March 2020 |language=sq}} The Serbian government then demanded that the Orthodox Albanians of Zhirovnica declare themselves as Serbs.{{cite book |last1=Pajaziti |first1=Ali |title=SHQIPTARËT E REKËS SË EPËRME |page=136 |url=https://www.academia.edu/23459558/SHQIPTARËT_E_REKËS_SË_EPËRME |accessdate=28 March 2020 |language=en}}{{cite news |last1=Dr. RAMIZ |first1=ZEKAJ |title=Zhvillimi i kultures islame te shqiptaret gjate shek XX |url=http://www.iium.edu.my/deed/quran/albanian/kultura.html |accessdate=28 March 2020 |work=www.iium.edu.my |issue=ZHVILLIMI I KULTURËS
